page.title: 10^^^Racing Stables, Chilton^^
page.content: ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Mr.James Bethell owns a racing stable in Chilton with 120 acres of land. Racing is popular in this part of the country because of the ground. The ground is good for riding because underneath there is chalk which means it has good drainage. Mr. Bethell has been running the racing stables for 3.5 years. He employs 10 people. Each person is responsible for 3 horses, except the headman and travelling headman. In his yard, there are 44 stables but only 26 horses at present. The yard was built after the second world war. He also employs quite a few famous jockeys such as Lester Pigott, Willy Carson, Steve Cauthen, Pat Eddery and John Mathius. ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
